Description: Fragment of a pierced object made of faience, probably an amulet, the upper part with perforation is preserved, one side is flat and without colour (rear), the other is rounded at the edges and flat in the middle part, at the area where the object is broken off, the surface is bending down slightly, suggesting a different part of the object starting here. The frontal middle part is coloured in a quite intense dark turqoise, fading to the edges where no colour is preserved an the object is beige to white. The upper part with the perforation has the shape of the upper part of a rounded drop.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
